## Checklist

Please check all that apply:

### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added type hints where applicable (Python)

### Testing
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested on multiple environments (if applicable)

### Documentation
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] I have updated the README.md if needed
- [ ] I have added docstrings to new functions/classes
- [ ] I have updated API documentation if needed

### Dependencies
- [ ] I have checked that my changes don't introduce new dependencies unnecessarily
- [ ] If new dependencies are added, I have updated requirements.txt
- [ ] New dependencies are properly licensed (compatible with MIT)

### Medical/Ethical Considerations
- [ ] My changes maintain/improve medical disclaimers
- [ ] I have not made claims about diagnostic accuracy without evidence
- [ ] Changes are clearly marked as educational/research only
- [ ] No patient data or PHI is included in the PR

### Security
- [ ] I have not exposed any secrets or credentials
- [ ] Input validation is implemented where needed
- [ ] No SQL injection or XSS vulnerabilities introduced
- [ ] Dependencies are from trusted sources
